BiblioData.Title: Nanosensors based on nanoparticles immobilized on stimuli responsive polymer brushes
BiblioData.Abstract: The invention is directed to a sensor comprising: - a substrate (1); - a polymer brush (4) formed of polymer molecules anchored by a first end to a surface of the substrate and having a second, free end located on a terminal end opposite to the first end; - nanoparticles (5) fixed to the second end of the polymer brush. The invention is further directed to a method for obtaining said sensor and the use of the sensor for detecting a variety of organic analytes.

Claims.P: 1. A sensor comprising:
- a substrate (1);
- a polymer brush (4) formed of polymer molecules anchored by a first end to a surface of the substrate and having a second, free end located on a terminal end opposite to the first end;
- nanoparticles (5) fixed to the second end of the polymer brush.
2. Sensor according to claim 1, wherein the polymer brush comprises a bonding group at the second end.
3. Sensor according to one of the preceding claims, wherein the polymer brush is formed from linear polymer chains.
4. Sensor according to one of the preceding claims, wherein the polymer brush is formed from hydrocarbon repeating units.
5. Sensor according to one of the preceding claims, wherein the polymer brush has a density of 0.05 to 0.5 polymer chains per nm<2>.
6. Sensor according to one of the preceding claims, wherein the polymer brush (4) is bound to the substrate (1) via an anchoring layer (3).
7. Sensor according to claim 6, wherein the anchoring layer is formed from a polymer comprising reactive groups.
8. Sensor according to one of the preceding claims, wherein the nanoparticles are formed from metals.

9. Sensor according to one of the preceding claims, wherein the nanoparticles are functionalized by surface molecules comprising a functional group that may bind to the bonding group of the polymer brush.
10. Sensor according to claim 9, wherein the surface molecule comprises a linking group for linking the surface molecule to the nanoparticle.
11. Method for obtaining a sensor according to one of claims 1 to 10 comprising the steps of:
- providing a substrate;
- providing a polymer brush formed of polymer molecules anchored by a first end to a surface of the substrate and having a second, free end located on a terminal end opposite to the first end;
- fixing nanoparticles to the second, free end of the polymer brush.

12. Method according to claim 11, wherein the nanoparticles are fixed to the second, free end of the polymer brush by providing a dispersion of the nanoparticles in a liquid and applying said dispersion to the polymer brush anchored by the first end to the surface of the substrate.
13. Method for detecting an analyte comprising the steps:
- providing a sensor according to one of claims 1 to 10;
- selecting a physical parameter of the sensor;
- determining the physical parameter thereby obtaining a reference value;
- applying a stimulus to the sensor;
- determining the physical parameter of the sensor in the presence of the stimulus, thereby obtaining a measured value;
- determining a difference between the reference value and the measured value.
14. Method according to claim 13 wherein the physical property of the sensor is a UV/VIS-absorption.
15. Method according to one of claims 13 and 14, wherein the analyte is provided in liquid phase.
